H0.text: when did korea separate into north and south. 1905

H1.text: when did korea separate into north and south. 1910

H2.text: when did korea separate into north and south. 1932

H3.text: when did korea separate into north and south. 1945

A4.text: The division of Korea began at the end of World War II on 2 September 1945 with the establishment of Soviet and US occupation zones.

A5.text: By the early 20th century, both countries were one single nation: the Korean Empire.

A6.text: In 1948, the zones formed their own governments.

A7.text: The proposal to split Korea at the 38th parallel was made in 1945, leading to its division.

A8.text: After the liberation of Korea from Japanese rule, Korea was immediately divided into areas under the rule of the Soviet Union and the United States.
